Title.evidence: In this study, we sought to review our institutional experience of sutureless aortic valve replacement (SU-AVR).

Trial_Design.evidence: We carried out a retrospective analysis of 200 consecutive patients who underwent an SU-AVR with a Perceval valve between December 2019 and February 2023.

Intervention.evidence: We carried out a retrospective analysis of 200 consecutive patients who underwent an SU-AVR with a Perceval valve between December 2019 and February 2023.

Objective.evidence: In this study, we sought to review our institutional experience of sutureless aortic valve replacement (SU-AVR).

Number_Randomised.evidence: We carried out a retrospective analysis of 200 consecutive patients who underwent an SU-AVR with a Perceval valve between December 2019 and February 2023.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The postoperative transvalvular mean pressure gradient was 6.3 ± 1.6 mmHg and stayed stable over the follow-up time.

Harms.evidence: We reported no cases of paravalvular leakage, and the incidence of stroke was 0.5%.
